Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery kantharos; interior glazed black with two bands in added red; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of a male wearing chiton with every other fold in red and red himation with a running key pattern with added white dots border, bending over to right; in front of figure, traces of horse's tail in white; at left, drapery with similar border and white dots between lines on vertical edge.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
For a parallel, see Oxford AN1896-1908-G.137.9.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 356, no. B455)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 226, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0740) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 96, pl. III, no. 12)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
